alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 26 at 6:23PM EDT until April 26 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JONES...NORTHWESTERN CRAVEN...WESTERN ONSLOW... SOUTHWESTERN BEAUFORT AND DUPLIN COUNTIES... At 623 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Kinston to near Willard, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Wallace, Half Moon, Phillips Crossroads, Kornegay, Rose Hill, Richlands, Beulaville, Catherine Lake, Cypress Creek, Comfort, Kenansville, Fort Barnwell, Chinquapin, Potters Hill, Petersburg, Pleasant Hill, Wyse Fork, Albertson and Harrells. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
